ETYMOLOGY: From English enormous + -ly, from Latin 'enormis' (out of rule, irregular, immense), from 'e-' (out of) + 'norma' (rule, pattern).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, an adjective, or another adverb, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To a very great extent; extremely or immensely.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new policy proved enormously beneficial to the economy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新政策对经济带来了巨大的好处。
